channel.title: Lab 5 on taskcat workshop
channel.description: Recent content in Lab 5 on taskcat workshop

item.title: Deploy CI/CD pipeline
item.description: To setup a CICD pipeline for your project, you need the following details. Make a note of the following before proceeding with the rest of the steps: - Your AWS Code Commit repository name Your AWS Code Commit repository Url (https://) Source branch name, where you will be pushing your changes Release branch name, where your changes needs to be promoted, after successfull test Launch stack To create a CICD pipeline, you will use a CloudFormation template.

item.title: View test and code promotion
item.description: Now, after your stack creation is completed successfully and you have a CICD pipeline setup, let’s see what does the pipeline do. View CICD pipeline On your Cloudformation console, click the Outputs tab. Look for CodePipelineURL, and open the link in a new tab in your browser. This will open the AWS Code Pipeline console, and you should see a pipeline. You may see that, either the Source action or the Build action is in-progress.
